I've been using Java 5 since I started using JUnit a couple months ago,
and have yet to run across any Java-related problem.  The only Java 5
features I'm using are things totally separate from anything JUnit
should care about, like generics.
 
 
Todd.


________________________________

	From: Metlis, Matthew B. [mailto:matthew.metlis@...] 
	Sent: Friday, February 04, 2005 9:56 AM
	To: junit@yahoogroups.com
	Subject: RE: [junit] Errors moving to 1.5
	
	
	
	Has anyone else used JUnit with Java 1.5?  I am curious whether
anyone
	else has, whether you have encountered problems or not, and have
you
	used JUnit to test classes that use new Java 1.5 features such
as
	parameterization?
	
	Thanks,
	Matthew Metlis
	
	      -----Original Message-----
	      From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...] 
	      Sent: Friday, February 04, 2005 10:52 AM
	      To: junit@yahoogroups.com
	      Subject: Re: [junit] Errors moving to 1.5
	      
	      
	      Metlis, Matthew B. wrote:
	      > 
	      > Hi, thank you for your suggestion.  I work with David on
the
	project
	      > where we moved to Java 1.5.  I downloaded JUnit and
built it
	from the
	      > source with 1.5.  First, compiling JUnit with Java 1.5
does
	not solve
	      > the problems David reports below.
	      
	      Hm. In that case, I don't know what to suggest. You're out
of my
	area of 
	      expertise.
	      
	      I hope someone else can help you.
	      --
